page.title: 04Employment in Blithfield
page.content: There is a variety of occupations in this area, the main one being farming. Farmers are usually run by the owner and his Stafordshire water works employ 5 full-time staff, whose jobs include looking after the reservoir and its surrounding fences and gates, the fish farm, managing 300 acres of woodland and a saw mill. The angling company has 2 full-time and 2 part-time staff, checking boats and restocking the reservoir with fish daily, these are purchased from the water works. There are also 2 boarding kennels. A small filling station and a small restaurant. Blithfield hall employs a full time gardener and 2 part time cleaners. Some of the inhabitants of the area work in the neighbourig towns of Rugeley & Stafford to which most of them travel by car owing to the lack of transport.
